snippet: A federal judge struck down parts of Utah’s anti-polygamy law as unconstitutional in a case brought by a star of “Sister Wives,” the reality television show.
abstract: Federal Judge Clark Waddoups strikes down parts of Utah's anti-polygamy law as unconstitutional in case brought by Kody Brown, Mormon star of reality television show Sister Wives; Brown and his family argue that state's prohibition on cohabitation violates their rights to privacy and religious freedom.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge struck down parts of Utah’s anti-polygamy law as unconstitutional in a case brought by a star of “Sister Wives,” the reality television show.

headline.main: A Utah Law Prohibiting Polygamy Is Weakened
headline.print_headline: A Utah Law Prohibiting Polygamy Is Weakened

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject
